Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the lantibiotic family (Class I bacteriocin)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Streptococcus dysgalatiae subsp dysgalactiae ATCC 27957 (IC50=0.69±0.05 µM), Vancomycin-resistant Enterococcusfaecium CNRZ 481 (IC50=0.84±0.05 µM), Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus C5 (IC50=2.23±0.03 µM), Bacillus anthracis Sterne 7702 (IC50=0.49±0.02 µM), Bacillus subtilis ATCC 6633 (IC50=0.55±0.01 µM), Lactococcus lactis HP ATCC 11602 (IC50=0.12±0.09 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Nonterminal Modifications and Unusual Am: Four lanthionines (S3-C7,S23-C27,S26-C30,S29-C33) and three β-methyllanthionines (T8-C11; T13-C18; T20-C24),S5 is dehydroalanines.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Extensive NMR characterization demonstrated that geobacillin I contains seven thioether cross-links, two more than the five cross-links found in nisin and the most cross-links found in any lantibiotic to date.
Sequence Information.Predicted Structure: There is no predicted structure for DRAMP00014.
Sequence Information.Function: Geobacillin I is active against a wide range of Gram positive bacteria but it not active against Gram-negative bacterium E. coli.
Sequence Information.Biophysicochemical properties: Geobacillin I is more stable than nisin at pH 7 and 8 at 37 and at 60 °C.

Literature.Title: Lantibiotics from Geobacillus thermodenitrificans.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2012 Apr 3;109(14)5241-5246.
Literature.Author: Garg N, Tang W, Goto Y, Nair SK, van der Donk WA.
